Sentencas: Lanthanum nickelate, La2NiO4+delta (LNO), is studied as a cathode material for use in solid oxide fuel cells with the objective of mitigating chromium poisoning.
Titulo: Improved Tolerance of Lanthanum Nickelate (La2NiO4+δ) Cathodes to Chromium Poisoning Under Current Load in Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Under current load, both electrochemical and chemical reactions cause chromium poisoning, and high current density and humidity accelerate the poisoning.
Titulo: Improved Tolerance of Lanthanum Nickelate (La2NiO4+δ) Cathodes to Chromium Poisoning Under Current Load in Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: However, compared with a standard strontium-doped lanthanum manganite cathode, the LNO cathode has a much higher tolerance for chromium poisoning.
Titulo: Improved Tolerance of Lanthanum Nickelate (La2NiO4+δ) Cathodes to Chromium Poisoning Under Current Load in Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: This can be ascribed to a greatly reduced chromium deposition in LNO.
Titulo: Improved Tolerance of Lanthanum Nickelate (La2NiO4+δ) Cathodes to Chromium Poisoning Under Current Load in Solid Oxide Fuel Cells
